citeinfo.title: National Transportation Atlas Databases (NTAD) 2011

pubinfo.publish: United States. Bureau of Customs and Border Protection

citeinfo.othercit: This data is created and maintained by the Customs and Border Protection (CBP), and spatially enhanced by BTS. The CBP also designated the port codes, names, and attributes.
citeinfo.origin: United States. Department of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration
United States. Bureau of Customs and Border Protection

descript.abstract: This point dataset represents border crossing ports in the United States and Mexico. Border crossing ports are points of entry for land modes along the U.S. - Canadian and U.S.- Mexcian borders. The ports of entry are located in 15 states along the U.S. borders.
descript.purpose: This dataset is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.
descript.supplinf: Used for the interface of Border Crossing/Entry Data: http://www.bts.gov/programs/international/transborder/TBDR_BC/TBDR_BC_Index.html. This data is created and maintained by the Customs and Border Protection (CBP), and spatially enhanced by BTS. The CBP also designated the port codes, names, and attributes. For any questions regarding the CBP data, please contact (877) CBP-5511.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

attracc.attraccr: The accuracy of the location data is very high. PortName and PortCode are extracted from the Census website: The link is: http://www.census.gov/foreign-trade/reference/codes/index.html Only 40% of data were converted from .csv files, others were from digitized manually using high resolution image as background (Google Earth).

procstep.procdesc: The creation of this geospatial data layer was completed by USDOT-RITA-BTS in November 2010 and updated in December 2011. Step 1: Convert textual data into shapefile using the ArcGIS function. Step 2: Export the shapefile into KML and display the ports on Google Earth. Each port was checked with road network and country bounderies. Corrections were made for the locations that are far from ports, then record their geographic coordinates. Step 3: Export KML file with port locations into shapefile using the third-party software. Then other attributes were added within ArcGIS.
Name changed from border_x to USBorderCross11

edom.edomvds: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: Number of arriving trucks; does not include privately owned pick-up trucks.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: A container (loaded) is any conveyance entering the U.S. used for commercial purposes, full or empty. In this case, it is the number of full or empty truck containers arriving at a port. This series includes containers moving as inbound shipments.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: A container (empty) is any conveyance entering the U.S. used for commercial purposes, full or empty. In this case, it is the number of full or empty truck containers arriving at a port. This series includes containers moving as inbound shipments.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: Number of arriving trains at a particular port.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: A container (loaded) is any conveyance entering the U.S. used for commercial purposes, full or empty. In this case, it is the number of full or empty rail containers arriving at a port. This series includes containers moving as inbound shipments.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: A container (empty) is any conveyance entering the U.S. used for commercial purposes, full or empty. In this case, it is the number of full or empty rail containers arriving at a port. This series includes containers moving as inbound shipments.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: Number of passengers and crew arriving by train and requiring U.S. Customs processing.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: Number of arriving buses at a particular port, whether or not they are carrying passengers.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: Number of persons arriving by bus requiring U.S. Customs processing.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: Number of privately owned vehicles (POVs) arriving at a particular port. Includes pick-up trucks, motorcycles, recreational vehicles, taxis, snowmobiles, ambulances, hearses, and other motorized private ground vehicles.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: Passengers Crossing In Privately Owned Vehicles-Persons entering the United States at a particular port by private automobiles, pick-up trucks, motorcycles, recreational vehicles, taxis, ambulances, hearses, tractors, snowmobiles and other motorized private ground vehicles.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

attr.attrdef: The number of persons arriving on foot or by certain conveyance (such as bicycles, mopeds, or wheel chairs) requiring U.S. Customs processing.
attr.attrdefs: United States. Dept. of Transportation. Research and Innovative Technology Administration

onlinopt.accinstr: NTAD is available for download at www.bts.gov/programs/geographic_information_services. The NTAD DVD can also be ordered from the online bookstore at www.bts.gov.
